Check It Out!! #AnthonyMackie, #Avengers, #Avengers4, #AvengersEndgame, #‎BradleyCooper, #BenedictCumberbatch, #BenedictWong, #BrieLarson, #CaptainAmerica, #ChadwickBoseman, #ChrisEvans, #ChrisHemsworth, #ChrisPratt, #CobieSmulders, #DanaiGurira, #DaveBautista, #DonCheadle, #ElizabethOlsen, #EvangelineLilly, #frankgrillo, #GuardiansOftheGalaxy, #GwynethPaltrow, #HiroyukiSanada, #InfinityWar, #JeremyRenner, #JonFavreau, #JoshBrolin, #KarenGillan, #KatherineLangford, #LetitiaWright, #MarkRuffalo, #Marvel, #PaulBettany, #PaulRudd, #PomKlementieff, #RobertDowneyJr, #SamuelLJackson, #ScarlettJohansson, #SebastianStan, #TessaThompson, #TildaSwinton, #TomHiddleston, #TomHolland, #TomVaughanLawlor, #VinDiesel, #WilliamHurt, #WinstonDuke, #ZoeSaldana

Marvel Studios and Disney have released a really neat new extended TV spot for Avengers: Endgame, and the best part is it reveals barely any footage from the new movie. Marvel has worked hard to keep the plot and specifics of Endgamea secret (and even some of the characters), so marketing for the film has been rather guarded. Honestly, if you know you’re going to see this movie anyway, why would…

summary: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015) - Review
title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015) - Review
body:
Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015) – Review

Avengers: Age of Ultron is the second Avengers film in the MCU and the 11th film in the Infinity Saga and is directed by Joss Wheldon. The Avengers team up once again to take down Ultron, a homicidal robot who has the wrong idea of what peace means.

I really enjoyed this film, it might be long at 2hrs 20 minutes but it’s worth it. We get an more in-depth look in to the characters lives and get…

summary: Flim Weakly Review- Captain Marvel
title: Flim Weakly Review- Captain Marvel
body:
He’s a Marvel of a different kind. In that it’s a marvel that he can walk and talk at the same time. Flim Weakly Review- Captain Marvel

Jean Luc Godard once said “Film is truth, 24 frames per second.” Now, I don’t know what that means, but I do know it’s wrong. Captain Marvel cannot be truth, because it’s made of film, and truth is made of emotions or something. I also don’t know who Jean Luc Godard is, or what 24 frames have to do with it, as frames are usually found in Asda, for pictures and photos to sit in.

Although,…

summary: So, what's the plan? - Chapter 1 - Otaku_no_Uta - Captain Marvel (2019) [Archive of Our Own]
title: So, what's the plan? - Chapter 1 - Otaku_no_Uta - Captain Marvel (2019) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 3/3
Fandom: Captain Marvel (2019), Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Chewie | Goose & Carol Danvers, Carol Danvers & James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Carol Danvers & Natasha Romanov
Characters: Carol Danvers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Steve Rogers, Bruce Banner, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Chewie | Goose (Marvel), Nick Fury (mentioned), mentions of Talos (Marvel), Thor (Marvel)
Additional Tags: Captain Marvel Spoilers, Carol meets the avengers, Endgame, Extended Scene, captain marvel mid credit scene, mentions of the snap and people getting dusted, Panic Attacks, it’s in the second chapter, read notes if you want to avoid it, mentions of the war between the skrulls and the kree, mentions of war and minor charachter death because of the snap, Spoilers, that one promo scene for avengers endgame
Summary:

“Where is Fury?”
The rest of the group turns around at the sound of the voice and the Avengers are now face to face with an unknown woman standing in their base of operation.

A continuation of the Captain Marvel mid-credit scene and what happens after Carol shows up.

And so the last chapter is here!!!

summary: Directors of Avengers Endgame: Please Do Not Spoil The Movie For Others
title: Directors of Avengers Endgame: Please Do Not Spoil The Movie For Others
body:
New Post has been published on https://www.worldofbuzz.com/directors-of-avengers-endgame-please-do-not-spoil-the-movie-for-others/

Directors of Avengers Endgame: Please Do Not Spoil The Movie For Others

Avengers: Endgame releases next week on 24 April 2019 and if you’re planning to catch this movie, do take note of the movie directors’ advice about movie spoilers, because they have something important to tell all of us!

Source: BGR

Recently, the Russo Brothers wrote an open letter to Marvel fans requesting them not to spoil the movie for other people. A snippet of their letter reads,

“Because so many of you have invested your time, and your souls into these stories, we’re once again asking for help.”

“When you see Endgame in the coming weeks, please don’t spoil it for others, the same way you wouldn’t want it spoiled for you.”

You can read the whole letter which was posted on the Russo brothers’ Twitter account below:

#DontSpoilTheEndgame pic.twitter.com/YZhbrwcijJ

— Russo Brothers (@Russo_Brothers) April 16, 2019

Prior to this, footage which was believed to contain some major spoiler began circulating on Reddit and Twitter but thankfully, it has been taken down by Disney’s lawyer. Good call! 

That said, let’s do us all a favour and refrain from posting spoilers online because more often than not, it can really ruin a person’s experience of the movie. We wouldn’t like that for ourselves, do we? 

On that note, we know you’re excited about the movie but perhaps, we should also avoid posting Instagram stories when we watch Avengers: Endgame in the cinemas because we may risk posting a spoiler on our social media account.

Besides the risk of posting spoilers, did you know that you can actually get fined for filming in the theatre hall and posting movie scenes on social media? Yep, you can read the article below to learn more about that!

Also read: You Can Get RM100,000 Fine or 5 Years Jail If You Record & Post Movie Scenes on Social Media

reblog.comment:
New Post has been published on https://www.worldofbuzz.com/directors-of-avengers-endgame-please-do-not-spoil-the-movie-for-others/

Directors of Avengers Endgame: Please Do Not Spoil The Movie For Others

Avengers: Endgame releases next week on 24 April 2019 and if you’re planning to catch this movie, do take note of the movie directors’ advice about movie spoilers, because they have something important to tell all of us!

Source: BGR

Recently, the Russo Brothers wrote an open letter to Marvel fans requesting them not to spoil the movie for other people. A snippet of their letter reads,

“Because so many of you have invested your time, and your souls into these stories, we’re once again asking for help.”

“When you see Endgame in the coming weeks, please don’t spoil it for others, the same way you wouldn’t want it spoiled for you.”

You can read the whole letter which was posted on the Russo brothers’ Twitter account below:

#DontSpoilTheEndgame pic.twitter.com/YZhbrwcijJ

— Russo Brothers (@Russo_Brothers) April 16, 2019

Prior to this, footage which was believed to contain some major spoiler began circulating on Reddit and Twitter but thankfully, it has been taken down by Disney’s lawyer. Good call! 

That said, let’s do us all a favour and refrain from posting spoilers online because more often than not, it can really ruin a person’s experience of the movie. We wouldn’t like that for ourselves, do we? 

On that note, we know you’re excited about the movie but perhaps, we should also avoid posting Instagram stories when we watch Avengers: Endgame in the cinemas because we may risk posting a spoiler on our social media account.

Besides the risk of posting spoilers, did you know that you can actually get fined for filming in the theatre hall and posting movie scenes on social media? Yep, you can read the article below to learn more about that!

Also read: You Can Get RM100,000 Fine or 5 Years Jail If You Record & Post Movie Scenes on Social Media
